result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tariq J Newson

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF312, 21CF440, 21CF460, 21CF461, 21CF462, 21CF647, 21CM375, 22CF189, 22CF190, 22CF418 called at 10:05am
Defendant Tariq J Newson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Tariq J Newson.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sonya Newson, Defendant's mother appears via telephone. 

Parties verify receipt and review of newest report from Dr. Schoenecker, not contesting findings. 

Atty Luchsinger requests of the Court direct 'someone' come in and provide services for Mr. Newson at the jail. 

Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty Luchsinger believes Mr. Newson remains 84th on the list for Mendota.

Atty Luchsinger gives bond argument; statement made by Mr. Newson's mother. 
ADA Parson objects to bond modification. 

The Court denies motion for bond modification; gives basis.

The Court indicates that it has already ordered once a bed is available, Mr. Newson is to be immediately transferred. 

The Court orders another report is to be filed prior to next court date, the Court clarifies that this is simply the normal follow up report during competency proceedings. 

The Court alerts parties that due to judicial rotation, this case will likely be assigned to Branch 4. 
recess: 10:23am 
NEXT: Review on 1/9/23 at 10:00am (Review of Competency)
Review hearing on October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:30pm 
Defendant Tariq J Newson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds probable cause on four corners of complaint. 
Based on prior findings(in other cases), the Court finds that there is reason to doubt Mr. Newson's competency to proceed in this case. 

The Court will hold hearing on competency to proceed on 10/4/22 at 10:00am with his other cases. 

Atty Rumpf raises concern that Mr. Newson is being housed at the jail waiting restoration to competency; Court joins in concern, directs Clerk to add 'forthwith' language to order
recess: 1:36pm

NEXT: Review Hearing on 10/4/22 at 10:00am

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 09-20-2022
